text: Sambice was a late 5th-century Iranian noblewoman from the Sasanian dynasty, who was the sister-wife of king (shah) Kavad I () and mother of his first son, Kawus. Perhaps she can be associated with the wife (or sister) of Kavad I who helped him escape from captivity in the Castle of Oblivion in 496. == References == == Sources == * Category:5th-century Iranian people Category:Sasanian queens Category:Women of the Sasanian Empire Category:Kavad I
